intro: Mollinedia wardellii, commonly known as the Wardell's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
